front.title: OpenID CAEP Event Types 1.0
front.workgroup: Shared Signals and Events Working Group

abstract.t: This document defines the Continous Access Evaluation Protocol (CAEP) Event Types. Event Types are introduced and defined in Security Event Token

section.name: Introduction
section.t: This specification is based on SSE Profile and uses the subject identifiers defined there.

section.name: Notational Considerations
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.name: Event Types
section.t:
The base URI for CAEP event types is:
https://schemas.openid.net/secevent/caep/event-type/

section.name: Session Revoked
section.t: Session Revoked signals that the session identified by the subject has been revoked.
The actual reason why the session was revoked might be specified with the nested reason_admin and/or reason_user attributes described below.

dl.dd: REQUIRED, JSON number: the time at which the session revocation occured. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time. This value must be less than or equal to the "iat" claim in the parent Security Event Token (SET).

dd.t: OPTIONAL, JSON string: describes the entity that invoked the session revocation.
Potential options:

ul.li: admin: an administrator revoked the session
user: the end-user revoked the session
policy: a policy evaluation resulted in the session revocation
system: a system or platform assertion resulted in the session revocation

dd.t: OPTIONAL, JSON string: an administrative message for logging and auditing
OPTIONAL, JSON string: a user-friendly message for display to an end-user
OPTIONAL, JSON string: tenant identifier

figure.name: Example: Session Revoked for Session ID
Example: Session Revoked for User using sub claim
Example: Session Revoked for User + Device

section.name: Token Claims Change
section.t: Token Claims Change signals that a claim in a token specified in the subject has changed.
The actual reason why the claims change occured might be specified with the nested reason_admin and/or reason_user attributes described below.

dl.dd: REQUIRED JSON number: the time at which the claims change occured. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time. This value must be less than or equal to the "iat" claim in the parent Security Event Token (SET).

dd.t: OPTIONAL, JSON string: describes the entity that invoked the session revocation.
Potential options:

ul.li: admin: an administrator revoked the session
user: the end-user revoked the session
policy: a policy evaluation resulted in the session revocation
system: a system or platform assertion resulted in the session revocation

dd.t: OPTIONAL, JSON string: an administrative message for logging and auditing
OPTIONAL, JSON string: a user-friendly message for display to an end-user
OPTIONAL, JSON string: tenant identifier

figure.name: Example: OIDC ID Token Claims Change

section.name: Credential Change
section.t: The Credential Change event signals that a credential was created, changed, revoked or deleted. Credential change scenarios include:

ul.li: certificate enrollment, renewal, revocation and deletion
second factor / passwordless credential enrollment and deletion (U2F, FIDO2, OTP, app-based)

section.t: The actual reason why the credential change occured might be specified with the nested reason_admin and/or reason_user attributes described below.

dl.dd: REQUIRED, JSON number: the time at which the claims change occured. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time. This value must be less than or equal to the "iat" claim in the parent Security Event Token (SET).
REQUIRED, JSON string: the current NIST Authenticator Assurance Level (AAL) as defined in
REQUIRED, JSON string: the previous NIST Authenticator Assurance Level (AAL) as defined in
REQUIRED, JSON string: the Authenticator Assurance Level increased or decreased

dd.t: OPTIONAL, JSON string: potential options:
REQUIRED, JSON string: potential options:
OPTIONAL, JSON string: describes the entity that invoked the session revocation.
Potential options:

ul.li: admin: an administrator revoked the session
user: the end-user revoked the session
policy: a policy evaluation resulted in the session revocation
system: a system or platform assertion resulted in the session revocation

dd.t: OPTIONAL, JSON string: an administrative message for logging and auditing
OPTIONAL, JSON string: a user-friendly message for display to an end-user
OPTIONAL, JSON string: tenant identifier
OPTIONAL, JSON string: credential friendly name
OPTIONAL, JSON string: issuer of the X.509 certificate as defined in
OPTIONAL, JSON string: serial number of the X.509 certificate as defined in
OPTIONAL, JSON string: FIDO2 Authenticator Attestation GUID as defined in

figure.name: Example: Provisioning a new FIDO2 authenticator

section.name: Device Compliance Change
section.t: Token Claims Change signals that a claim in a token specified in the subject has changed.
The actual reason why the claims change occured might be specified with the nested reason_admin and/or reason_user attributes described below.

dl.dd: REQUIRED, JSON number: the time at which the claims change occured. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time. This value must be less than or equal to the "iat" claim in the parent Security Event Token (SET).

dd.t: REQUIRED, JSON string: the compliance status prior to the change that triggered the event
Options:
REQUIRED, JSON string: the current status that triggered the event
Options:
OPTIONAL, JSON string: describes the entity that invoked the session revocation
Potential options:

ul.li: admin: an administrator revoked the session
user: the end-user revoked the session
policy: a policy evaluation resulted in the session revocation
system: a system or platform assertion resulted in the session revocation

dd.t: OPTIONAL, JSON string: an administrative message for logging and auditing
OPTIONAL, JSON string: a user-friendly message for display to an end-user
OPTIONAL, JSON string: tenant identifier

figure.name: Example: Device has gone out of compliance
